ai.summary: A 10.2 km looped hike in the UK designed for hikers with moderate fitness, offering a mix of countryside scenery and community-accessible paths along accessible routes.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surface terrain including paved paths, gravel tracks, and grassy sections. Gentle gradients with occasional slightly uneven ground; expect mud after wet weather.
ai.safety_notes: Plan around daylight hours and weather; wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers with a waterproof outer layer. Stay on marked paths, and be cautious at road crossings near villages. Carry water and snacks, have a basic map or offline navigation, and tell someone your route and expected return. Mobile reception may be limited in rural stretches.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing with a lightweight waterproof jacket
Map, compass, or offline navigation app
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late return)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are generally ideal for this trail with milder temperatures and longer daylight. Summer offers longer days but can be busier; shoulder seasons can be muddy after rain. Winter hiking is possible with proper gear, but daylight is shorter and conditions may be tougher.

seo.title: Hatherleigh Community Trail - 10.2 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 10.2 km Hatherleigh Community Trail in the UK. A moderate hike with mixed terrain, practical safety tips, and gear recommendations.
